result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo Beaton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lorenzo Beaton in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Lorenzo Beaton in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for trial today but a resolution has been reached.  
As to count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Victim is present in court and sentencing may proceed.    Statements to the court by all parties.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 160 days  in the House of Correction, with credit for 157 days time served.  
The court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA sample and surcharge to be paid by 4-5-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lorenzo Beaton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody in Kenosha on Federal hold.  Trial date of 10-5-15 to stand.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lorenzo Beaton not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has filed a PROMPT DISPOSITION REQUEST.  Case set for final pretrial on 9-21-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-5-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHRISTY J. OR HER CHILDREN AND SOPHIA M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Lorenzo Beaton in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Lorenzo Beaton in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge WAGNER, Br. 38.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Received & Filed, Letter from defendant requesting Prompt Disposition.  Letter received from an in-custody defendant who is requesting case be resolved in anticipation of release.  Copy of letter forwarded to S. Schrader, DA's Office, for action.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
